name: passion
intro: I've been developing for a year, and am always eager to learn more! Here is a sample of what I've been working on lately in my free time.

projects.title: Mood App Revamp
projects.description: The purpose of this app is twofold; I aim to provide users with a hassle-free platform to practice mindfulness by consistently answering a set of customizable questions, and to track their mood trends over time.

projects.title: Indelicate Scraping
projects.description: Though it be uncouth, I've been harvesting the API of a (disappointly unimaginative) porn site for its fun word patterns in order to play with python and interact with an existing dataset. As of yet, I have not found anything that the average thirteen-year-old boy couldn't tell you, but I have some plans for examining and showcasing this trove of smut.

secondary: Though I entered web development because I believed my interest in art could bridge the gap between design and development, I've become far more interested in the logic necessary to craft effective code. Though I love a clean user interface, my interests are veering further back in the stack.

name: experience
intro: After a three-month stretch with General Assembly's Web Development Immersive in Chicago and a two-month stint of job applications, coding challenges, and hacked freelance projects, I entered the workforce with wide eyes and an expanding conceptual framework. Before working for nearly 3/4 of a year as a developer at the design agency Multiple, Inc., I never would have imagined I'd...
accomplishments: teach myself the flux-like Vue-Vuex state management pattern, pioneering use of this technology at my firm
work with UI libraries including GSAP, ScrollMagic, and Packery to create fluid interactions
develop an understanding of our virtual machine environments
design and construct a plugin in Craft CMS (PHP/JavaScript)
design a complex Rails API for a research survey tool
construct logical and well organized stylesheets using a modular BEM strategy
be able to articulate why Middleman and Gulp were no longer useful in our evolving development environments

name: skills
intro: I began my journey at General Assembly and have continued to rigorously self-teach since graduating. At GA, the stack we practiced consisted of:

tertiary: Furthermore, I'm always working hard to understand a variety of computer science concepts and applications in order to further improve my programmatic decision-making.
